name: GAG - Genome Annotation Generator
tagline: Console-based application to read, sanitize, annotate and modify genomic data. Can exportsshi an NCBI .tbl file of annotations on a genome.
body:
# Genome Annotation Generator

A console-based program to read, modify, annotate and output genomic data. Can write files to .gff3 or to the NCBI's .tbl format.


###Example Usage
In this exciting vignette, you will create a .tbl file from the .fasta and .gff files provided in the 'walkthrough' directory. You should run these commands from within the main GAG directory, or else adjust the file paths.

####Run program
    python console.py

####Read in data
    GAG> loadfolder walkthrough

####Write .tbl file 
    GAG> writetbl foo.tbl

####Go on your merry way
    GAG> exit

With any luck, you now have a file in your working directory called 'foo.tbl'. There may be any number of things wrong with it -- please get in touch with us so we can fix whatever ridiculous errors we have made. We're all in this together :)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
